title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A 
- Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) (Restrictions upon Travel to the State 
from Certain States) (No. 5) (Amendment) Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on the 14th day of May

heading: 2. The Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - Temporary Restrictions) (Covid19) (Restrictions upon Travel to the State from Certain States) (No. 5)
text_raw:
2. The Health Act 1947 (Section 31A - Temporary Restrictions) (Covid19) (Restrictions upon Travel to the State from Certain States) (No. 5) 
Regulations 2021 (S.I. No. 135 of 2021) are amended in paragraph (10) of 
the following subparagraph for 
Regulation 9, by 
subparagraph (e): 

the substitution of 

“(e) 

carry out 

to 
essential 
construction or safety assurance relating to - 

repair, maintenance, 

(i) 

(ii) 

critical transport infrastructure and services 
(including 
and 
decommissioning of such infrastructure and 
services), 

commissioning 

the 

critical utility infrastructure (including the 
commissioning and decommissioning of such 
infrastructure), 

(iii) critical public services, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 21st May, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [242] 3 

(iv) manufacturing services, 

(v) 

information services, or 

(vi) communications services,”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

13 May, 2021. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health.

title: Interest) Act 2020 (No. 1 of 2020)) of the Health Act 1947 (No. 28 of 1947)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These regulations amend Statutory Instrument No. 135 of 2021 with regard to 
provisions for essential workers.
